text: at the leader of India's main opposition
Congress party Rahul Gandhi has resigned
the party was defeated again in the
recent elections by Narendra Modi's BJP
Rahul Gandhi has been the leader of the
Indian National Congress since late 2017
his family and party have dominated
Indian politics since independence from
Britain Devi area has more from Delhi
the announcement must have disappointed
many party workers and indeed party
leaders who have been making a beeline
for mr. Rahul Gandhi's residence in the
past weeks trying to convince him to not
resign from the party he had made his
intent clear right the day after the
results came out spelling a huge huge
defeat for the Congress party and a
massive landslide win for the ruling BJP
but mr. Rahul Gandhi's resignation was
not accepted by the party today putting
all speculations to rest
he has tweeted an open letter which runs
into four pages saying that he's
officially resigning from his post his
Twitter bio now reads only member of
Indian National Congress and Member of
Parliament instead of the president of
the Indian National Congress now he has
alleged that these elections were not
free and fair that they lacked a free
press and independent judiciary a
transparent Election Commission and he
says that the Congress party in fact was
fighting the whole state machinery in
this election not just the opposition
parties and specifically the BJP he said
that he does not have any hatred for the
BJP but he does not agree with their
politics he says that he led his party
and fought on the issues of transparency
and love and brotherhood whereas the BJP
fought on divisiveness and hatred
something that the BJP has responded to
after his tweet and denied but now the
big question is what happens next will
this open the party to opportunism and
chaos because the party has been led by
the Gandhi family for a really long time
in fact the Indian National Congress
which is called the Grand Old Party in
India has been accused of dynastic
politics a charge that was actually
taken up very vociferously by the
current prime minister mr. Narendra Modi
who claims that his origins are very
humble that he was a son of a tea seller
and there
a complete contrast to the Congress
party which is led by diners Shiva area
reporting there from Delhi
